benchmark_details.name: AeroVerse
benchmark_details.overview: AeroVerse is a benchmark suite for simulating, pre-training, fine-tuning, and evaluating aerospace embodied world models, specifically for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). It includes two pre-training datasets (AerialAgent-Ego10k and CyberAgent-Ego500k), five downstream task instruction datasets, and a comprehensive evaluation method based on GPT-4.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for advancing aerospace embodied intelligence and empowering UAV agents with autonomous capabilities.

data.source: AerialAgent-Ego10k and CyberAgent-Ego500k pre-training datasets, and SkyAgent task instruction datasets constructed using AeroSimulator.
data.size: 10,000 images for AerialAgent-Ego10k; 500,000 images for CyberAgent-Ego500k; 3,000 examples for each of the five SkyAgent tasks.
data.annotation: Annotated by trained professionals using defined guidelines for UAV-specific tasks.

methodology.calculation: BLEU, SPICE scores calculated based on n-gram matches; LLM-Judge evaluates alignment with human feedback through prompt templates.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with human preferences and understanding of task requirements.
methodology.baseline_results: Various baselines evaluated including 2D and 3D visual-language models on the UAV tasks.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted across multiple datasets and models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collected with attention to user privacy and anonymization where applicable.
